page.title: 18An ex-Steelworker's story
page.content: I was made redundant in 1981 after working at the BSC Aldwarke site for six years. I worked as a Diesel Technician on many forms of commercial and plant machinery. At the time I was working part-time in a public house and had the chance of becoming a publican. I decided to take the opportunity while I was still young enough to start a new venture so my redundancy was 'voluntary'. Redundancy pay was offered but as I had decided to leave the industry alternative work did not interest me. Ten of my workmates were made redundant also. I lost touch with most of them although I know two of them started their own businesses. As far as I know the others are still unem- ployed. One month after taking redundancy I became a publican.
